newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil products firm with futures and fair demand.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products firm with futures and fair demand.

text.p: NWE oil products were firmer on Thursday.
Gasoline was up with crude. Barges traded up to $207.50 fob ARA. Cargo markets were tight.
Naphtha was up, too. Full-range material is seen cheaper than light or heavy naphtha.
Gas oil was stronger on futures and firm premiums. Brazil was seen taking 60,000 tonnes of Russian.
Fuel oil barges traded several times at $100 fob ARA, peaked at $100.50 before slipping back to $98-99. Cargoes were up nearly $8 a tonne. -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 7714.
